messages.title: CONSERVATIVE MAJORITY GOVERNMENT
messages.content: GETTING ON WITH THE COUNTRY’S PRIORITIES

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS – and funding new hospitals, creating 50 million more appointments in GP practices and investing in cancer screening machines.
20,000 extra police officers – with 1,369 for London in the first year. And making sure they have the powers to keep our streets safe.
More funding for every pupil in every school – so every child gets a better education, no matter what.
Avoiding economic chaos – with no hikes in tax to pay for his 'eye-watering' plans to put politicians in charge of rail, energy, water and postal services.
More dithering and indecision – meaning no progress made on our priorities such as the NHS and cutting crime.
Putting excellent schools at risk – by scrapping Ofsted and abolishing SATs tests. Keeping parents in the dark on their children's progress and school safety.

mentions.tacticalSituation: London voters in fewer than a dozen seats could decide if Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn is the next Prime Minister. Gap between Tories and Labour shrinks.

issues.economy: Economic chaos – with hikes in tax to pay for his 'eye-watering' plans to put politicians in charge of rail, energy, water and postal services.
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school – so every child gets a better education, no matter what. Putting excellent schools at risk – by scrapping Ofsted and abolishing SATs tests.
issues.governance: More dithering and indecision – meaning no progress made on our priorities such as the NHS and cutting crime.
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS – and funding new hospitals, creating 50 million more appointments in GP practices and investing in cancer screening machines.

endorsements.endorser: ITV News, The Times, The Herald, Evening Standard, Reuters

quotes.text: SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence – REUTERS

images.caption: London voters in fewer than a dozen seats could decide if Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn is the next Prime Minister.
Gap between Tories and Labour shrinks

leaflet.additionalNotes: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.
